Header: Protesters burn U.S. and NATO flags during Pompeo visit in Athens
Content: Protesters burned U.S. and NATO flags in Athens as the U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo held meetings with Greek government officials. Thousands marched outside the U.S. Embassy in the Greek capital, holding up signs that read “Pompeo go home,” and threw red paint on a statue of former U.S. president Harry Truman in the city centre. Greece and the United States have traditionally close relations even though many blame Washington for its tacit support for a military junta that ruled Greece between 1967 and 1974. Protest marches to the U.S. Embassy are an annual event.
